definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: I am on top of the wold.
Our patience has been taxed to the limit.
Don't strain your bow to the breaking-point.
Venus is best beauty because the arm break.
sentences.chinese: 维纳斯因为断臂才美到极点。

sentences.english: Because at the North Pole every direction is south.
sentences.chinese: 因为在北极点，所有的方向都是南方。

sentences.english: Some children become so addicted to the foreign snacks that they will go eating whenever possible。
sentences.chinese: 有些孩子对洋快餐迷恋到了极点，一有可能就要去吃。

sentences.english: Our distress, my dear Lizzy, is very great.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的丽萃，我们真是痛苦到极点。

sentences.english: Today is just not my day.
sentences.chinese: 我今天真是倒楣到极点。

sentences.english: His happiness was consummated when he heard the good news.
sentences.chinese: 他听到喜讯后快乐到极点。

sentences.english: Debby is in low water,but he has not been completely down and out yet.
sentences.chinese: 戴比处境困难，但还没到极点。

sentences.english: We were all supercharged with anger by his behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为令我们全都愤怒到了极点。

sentences.english: Our patience has been taxed to the limit.
The South Pole and the North Pole are antipodes.
sentences.chinese: 地球的极点称作北极和南极。

sentences.english: The pole was thus the fundamental basis of Chinese astronomy.
sentences.chinese: 因此极点是中国天文学的根基。

sentences.english: Often happy have bigger inanity to the pole , the general association sorrowful.
sentences.chinese: 每每快乐到极点，总会有更大的空虚悲伤。

sentences.english: I was in such a terrible mood that everything was tasteless to me.
sentences.chinese: 心情坏到极点了，吃什么都寡淡无味。

definition: in the extreme (idiom)/incapable of further increase
stage/degree (to which a situation has evolved)/situation/leeway
to make one's hair stand up in anger (idiom); to raise people's hackles
